title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Boil the spaghetti until al dente. In a separate pan, fry pancetta until crispy. Beat the eggs with parmesan in a bowl. Drain the pasta, then quickly mix with pancetta and remove from heat. Stir in the egg mixture while tossing to create a creamy sauce. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Carefully stir in the boiling water until the batter is smooth. The batter will be thin.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Jollof Rice with Chicken
summary: A popular West African dish made with rice, tomatoes, and spices, served with fried chicken.
instructions: Season beef with salt and pepper, coat with flour, then sear in a hot pan. Add onions, carrots, and potatoes. Stir in tomato paste and beef broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours until beef is tender. Adjust seasoning and serve hot.
